text: The 1988 San Francisco Giants season was the Giants' 106th season in Major League Baseball, their 31st season in San Francisco since their move from New York following the 1957 season, and their 29th at Candlestick Park. The team finished in fourth place in the National League West with an 83-79 record, 11½ games behind the Los Angeles Dodgers. ==Offseason== * December 1, 1987: Brett Butler was signed as a free agent with the Giants.Brett Butler at Baseball Reference * December 1, 1987: Joel Youngblood was signed as a free agent by the Giants.Joel Youngblood at Baseball Reference * December 21, 1987: Phil Ouellette was released by the Giants.Phil Ouellette at Baseball Reference * January 8, 1988: Atlee Hammaker was signed as a free agent by the Giants.Atlee Hammaker at Baseball Reference ==Regular season== ===Opening Day starters=== *Mike Aldrete *Brett Butler *Will Clark *Dave Dravecky *Candy Maldonado *Francisco Meléndez *Kevin Mitchell *Robby Thompson *José Uribehttp://www.baseball-almanac.com/teamstats/roster.php?y=1988&t;=SFN ===Season standings=== ===Record vs. opponents=== ===Notable transactions=== * June 1, 1988: Steve Decker was drafted by the Giants in the 21st round of the 1988 Major League Baseball draft.
